info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 06 at 5:43PM CST until March 06 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN CLAY AND NORTHEASTERN DUNKLIN COUNTIES... At 543 PM CST, a confirmed tornado was located over Pollard, or near Chalk Bluff Natural Area, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Malden, Campbell, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, St. Francis, Saint Francis, Glennonville, Valley Ridge, Providence, Morris State Park, Wilhelmina, Brian, Chalk Bluff Battlefield Park, McGuires and Townley. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
